t: Fleer - Company
s: The industrial and commercial activity of the CONFECTIONERY market was based on two brands, DUBBLE BUBBLE for bubble gum and CLIX for chewing gum. A great distribution effort was made in the national market, achieving a significant presence in the points of sale.

t: Who acquired Fleer?
The History of Fleer and SkyBox
s: In December 1913, Fleer left the Sen-Sen board and established the Frank H. Fleer Corporation with $150,000 in capital. In 1914, Sen-Sen Chiclet Company and the Chiclets brand were absorbed by the American Chicle Company. Frank H. Fleer died of a stroke on October 31, 1921.

t: Fleer - Wikipedia
s: March 15, 2025 - The Fleer Corporation, founded by Frank H. Fleer in 1885, was the first company to successfully manufacture bubble gum; it remained a family-owned enterprise until 1989. Fleer originally developed a bubble gum formulation called Blibber-Blubber in 1906. While this gum could be blown into bubbles, ...

t: Fleer Corporation | Encyclopedia.com
s: The Fleer Corporation holds a special position in the history and development of two quintessentially American activities: bubble gum and trading cards. After nearly seventy years, Fleer continues to manufacture more than four million pieces of its Dubble Bubble—the original bubble gum—each day.
